chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bailey Shayne Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bailey Shayne Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bailey Shayne Martin was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to attend Restorative Justice Program and Victim Impact Panel.
-Defendant to place flowers at the accident location every October 24th of every year during the period of Probation.
-Defendant to pay not less than $250.00 per month towards an education fund for Victim's son through the Department of Corrections during the period of Probation.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Bailey Shayne Martin appeared from jail. Case called at 2:02. Court reviews completed PSI. Atty. Nelson makes one correction to PSI. ADA Nieskes updates the court and makes sentencing recommendations. DE has completed treatment. Victim's family reads statements.  Recess at 2:26. Case recalled at 2:31. Atty. Nelson makes sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Court Imposes/Stays
10 years total 
4 years initial 
6 years ES

Court orders:
- 6 years probation with conditions:
- 10 months condition time
  First 4 mo condition time to be served commencing today and 1 mo. conditon time for the balance of probation to be served over Jordans birthday every year. 
  Huber granted for employment only. 
  Credit for 95 days against any ultimate sentence.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Restitution of $529.61
- AODA and any recommended follow through.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE to attend Restoritive Justice and victim impact.
- DE to complete 200 hours of community service. 
- DE to place flowers at the accident location every Oct. 24th every year during the period of probation.
- DE to pay not less than $250 per mo. towards an education fund for victims son through the dept. of corrections during the period of probation. 
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.

DE remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF:  Bailey Shayne Martin appeared. Case called at 2:11. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Nelson agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CF501. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF501. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF501 and 15TR5282. Court orders a PSI to be completed quickly.  Atty. Nelson argues the PSI. ADA Nieskes responds. Court revokes bail and DE is remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
